name: Qubes OS
description: Qubes OS is a security-focused Linux distribution that uses virtualization to isolate different tasks into secure compartments called qubes. It is based on Fedora but also supports Debian, Whonix, and others as template OSes.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Qubes OS began in 2012 as a project by security expert Joanna Rutkowska, aiming to provide a desktop OS designed for extreme security through compartmentalization.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Qubes OS evolved into a fully compartmentalized system using Xen-based virtualization to isolate applications and operating environments into disposable or persistent virtual machines.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Qubes is actively maintained and used by journalists, activists, and security professionals. It remains one of the most security-focused operating systems available.

sections.title: Security Model
sections.text: Qubes OS enforces strong isolation using lightweight VMs for different activities. Even if one qube is compromised, the others remain unaffected, adhering to the security-through-compartmentalization model.
